It’s TIME we do it RIGHT for our SKIN Today there are very few true soaps on the market. Most body cleansers, both liquid and solid, are actually synthetic detergent products.Take a look at the list of ingredients for an average bar of soap in your local store. It could contain sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS), an anionic surfactant used in laundry detergent that will dry out and irritate your skin. It may also have sodium laureth sulfate (SLES), a cheap foaming agent that can become contaminated with the suspected carcinogen Dioxane while being manufacturedIf it’s labeled as antibacterial it probably contains triclosan. This chemical is classified as a pesticide by the Environmental Protection Agency. Three quarters of antibacterial liquid soaps and a third of antibacterial bar soaps contain triclosan, which is thought to be contributing to increasing bacterial resistance across the world

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smells great and is very refreshing
reviews.reviewText: The Feel Men's Soap bar Handmade in Masculine Fragrance with Patchouli, Pine Tar, and Charcoal is a game-changer in my daily grooming routine. This soap bar not only delivers a refreshing and invigorating experience but also leaves me feeling clean and confident throughout the day. Here's why I highly recommend it:First and foremost, the masculine fragrance of this soap is captivating. The combination of patchouli, pine tar, and charcoal creates a unique and alluring scent that exudes confidence and sophistication. It provides a subtle and long-lasting fragrance that leaves a lasting impression.The handmade quality of this soap bar is evident in its exceptional performance. The natural ingredients and craftsmanship result in a luxurious lather that effectively cleanses the skin, removing dirt and impurities. It rinses off easily, leaving no residue or dryness behind.The addition of charcoal in this soap bar offers an added benefit. Charcoal is known for its detoxifying properties, drawing out impurities and excess oils from the skin. It helps to unclog pores and leaves the skin feeling refreshed and rejuvenated.The longevity of this soap bar is impressive. It doesn't melt away quickly like some mass-produced soaps, making it a cost-effective option. The generous size ensures that it lasts for an extended period, providing excellent value for money.One aspect that sets this soap bar apart is its commitment to using natural ingredients. It is free from harsh chemicals and artificial additives, making it gentle on the skin. This is particularly important for those with sensitive skin or allergies, as it minimizes the risk of irritation.In conclusion, the Feel Men's Soap bar Handmade in Masculine Fragrance with Patchouli, Pine Tar, and Charcoal is a must-have for men seeking a high-quality soap with a captivating scent. Its handmade craftsmanship, invigorating fragrance, cleansing properties, and natural ingredients make it a standout choice. With this soap bar, I can confidently start my day feeling fresh and rejuvenated. I highly recommend this soap bar to any man who appreciates a premium grooming experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Smell good but not overwhelming. Prefer non-flowery and non-heavy and these are perfect. “Male” qualifier is silly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It’s a lot smaller in size than what picture suggests. Doesn’t lather well but it does seem to remove oils from your skin extremely well without drying out your skin. If you have very oily skin then this would be perfect. The scent smells strong upon opening but scent fades after use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really great deal!
reviews.reviewText: Four of the best smelling soaps for men, and at a good price. I have to say the patchouli bar with peppermint leaves is able to be smelled from a few feet. This is a plus right out the box. I thought immediately that there is some quality ingredients here. Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Review of all 4 bars in this bundle
reviews.reviewText: To be helpful to others, here is a review of all 4 bars in this bundle. Keep in mind any scent review is subjective as different people love/dislike different scents:1. Patchouli - amazing scent (can really smell patchouli, but not overpowering). Great/moisturizing on skin. It actually has mint leaves in the bar itself that provide light exfoliation. Grit is very light. NOTE - I know some hate patchouli, so obviously this one is not for those folks2. Bay Rum - 0 scent of anything resembling the scent of “bay rum”. As a matter of fact I can only detect the smell of oil used in this bar, nothing else. It does not smell bad, but if you are seeking a scented bar, this has none of that. It is very nice on skin and is the best moisturizer of all the bars in my opinion. Your skin feels great after shower. 0 grit smooth bar.3. Citrus - same as bay rum, there is 0 scent of anything citrus-related here. Again, I can only smell “oil”. It is not as good as bay rum at moisturizing either, so it has nothing good going for it. Light grit.4. Pine tar and charcoal - This one does have a fragrance scent, but it is completely unrelated to pine tar - just smells like perfume. There is very little charcoal in it (which could be good if you don’t want to stain your tub, but not enough for me personally). Light grit.PROS: price (comes to about 4 bucks a bar) and the patchouli bar, which is amazing.CONS: all other bars aside patchouli are bad in my opinionConclusion: I recommend buying just the patchouli bar separately as others are not worth it at all. Again, my subjective 2 cents.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It smells exactly as described
reviews.reviewText: The quality of the product is great, you can definitely notice the rustic look imperfect look that is reminiscent of a home made bar of soap. This is my first bar of soap from this maker and it was the Patchouli, which is described as an earthy musky aroma reminiscent of wet soil. I personally store my soap in a ziplock back in order to prevent the water from hitting it and causing it to dissolve rapidly. Now the first day I used the bar the smell was very mild, however on the second day of use I quickly notice that the scent was very strong, probably around 6 times as much as the first day (something that people with very sensitive noses should beware of) and oh musky it was! I don’t know how to put it but for a minute I thought my dog (who sleeps on my pile of dirty clothes when I shower) had some flatulence, because the scent caught me off guard. But I quickly noticed that as soon as I put the soap back in the ziplock and rinsed off the soap from my body the super strong smell dissipated. Now if you can bear through the strong smell as you shower then you’ll find that the strong smell doesn’t linger much and you’re left with your skin smelling mildly of soil. I personally think that this aroma was not for me but I don’t want to write a negative review as the soap delivered as promised, and the overall quality was outstanding. I definitely look forward to trying other scents as I was really impressed with this brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Only liked half of the aromas.
